Generation I.Red: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
Generation I.Yellow: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
Generation I.Stadium: Repeatedly kicks its enemy with legs that freely stretch and contract. Some people refer to it as the "kicking master."

Generation II.Gold: This amazing Pok é mon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
Generation II.Silver: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
Generation II.Crystal: It is also called the Kick Master. It uses its elastic legs to execute every known kick.
Generation II.Stadium 2: This amazing Pok é mon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Hitmonlee 's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
Generation III.Sapphire: Hitmonlee 's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
Generation III.Emerald: Its legs freely stretch and contract. Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its tired legs.
Generation III.FireRed: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra-long, loping strides.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
Generation IV.HeartGold: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

Generation V.White 2: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

Generation VI.X: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
Generation VI.Y: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.

Generation VIII.Sword: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
Generation VIII.Shield: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its legs can stretch to double their length. First-time foes are startled by Hitmonlee's extensible reach.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its legs can stretch to double their length. First-time foes are startled by Hitmonlee's extensible reach.

Generation IX.Scarlet: At the exact moment it lands a kick on its target, Hitmonlee hardens the muscles on the sole of its foot, maximizing the power of the kick.
Generation IX.Violet: It has complete control over the ligaments in its legs, expanding and contracting them to double the reach of its kicks.
